docs.snippet: Four months after joining Inter Milan for nearly 30 million euros, Brazilian striker Gabriel Barbosa is still waiting for his first real chance to show his new club what he is capable of....
docs.lead_paragraph: Four months after joining Inter Milan for nearly 30 million euros, Brazilian striker Gabriel Barbosa is still waiting for his first real chance to show his new club what he is capable of.

headline.main: Gabriel Still Waiting for First Big Chance With Inter
headline.print_headline: Gabriel Still Waiting for First Big Chance With Inter

docs.snippet: Leading Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage, who has said he wants to be a bridge between the British government and the new U.S. administration, will attend U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration later this month....
docs.lead_paragraph: Leading Brexit campaigner Nigel Farage, who has said he wants to be a bridge between the British government and the new U.S. administration, will attend U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration later this month.

headline.main: Brexit Campaigner Farage to Attend Trump Inauguration
headline.print_headline: Brexit Campaigner Farage to Attend Trump Inauguration

docs.snippet: South Korea will form a special military brigade this year tasked with removing North Korea's leadership in the event of war as Seoul looks for options to counter its rival's nuclear weapons and missiles, an official said Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: South Korea will form a special military brigade this year tasked with removing North Korea's leadership in the event of war as Seoul looks for options to counter its rival's nuclear weapons and missiles, an official said Thursday.

headline.main: S. Korea to Form Brigade to Remove North's Leadership in War
headline.print_headline: S. Korea to Form Brigade to Remove North's Leadership in War

docs.snippet: Militias fighting alongside Iraqi troops against Islamic State are committing war crimes using weapons provided to the Iraqi military by the United States, Europe, Russia and Iran, Amnesty International said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Militias fighting alongside Iraqi troops against Islamic State are committing war crimes using weapons provided to the Iraqi military by the United States, Europe, Russia and Iran, Amnesty International said on Thursday.

headline.main: U.S., European Weapons Used to Commit War Crimes in Iraq: Amnesty
headline.print_headline: U.S., European Weapons Used to Commit War Crimes in Iraq: Amnesty

docs.snippet: Striker Emmanuel Adebayor will captain Togo at the African Nations Cup despite being without a club since leaving Premier League side Crystal Palace last May, the country's football federation said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Striker Emmanuel Adebayor will captain Togo at the African Nations Cup despite being without a club since leaving Premier League side Crystal Palace last May, the country's football federation said on Thursday.

headline.main: Clubless Adebayor to Captain Togo at Nations Cup
headline.print_headline: Clubless Adebayor to Captain Togo at Nations Cup

docs.snippet: Thousands packed a 1,300-year-old Shinto shrine in downtown Tokyo on Wednesday, the first official working day of 2017 in Japan, to pray for good luck and economic success in the new year....
docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands packed a 1,300-year-old Shinto shrine in downtown Tokyo on Wednesday, the first official working day of 2017 in Japan, to pray for good luck and economic success in the new year.

headline.main: Japanese Throng Shrines to Pray for Profitable 2017
headline.print_headline: Japanese Throng Shrines to Pray for Profitable 2017

docs.snippet: Sterling rose against the dollar for the second day running on Thursday, as more upbeat data underlined the UK economy's post-Brexit resilience and helped the pound make the most of a retreating greenback....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sterling rose against the dollar for the second day running on Thursday, as more upbeat data underlined the UK economy's post-Brexit resilience and helped the pound make the most of a retreating greenback.

headline.main: Sterling Capitalises on Dollar Retreat After Data Lift
headline.print_headline: Sterling Capitalises on Dollar Retreat After Data Lift

docs.snippet: Iraqi forces have retaken around 70 percent of eastern Mosul from Islamic State militants and expect to reach the river bisecting the city in the coming days, Iraq's joint operations commander told Reuters....
docs.lead_paragraph: Iraqi forces have retaken around 70 percent of eastern Mosul from Islamic State militants and expect to reach the river bisecting the city in the coming days, Iraq's joint operations commander told Reuters.

headline.main: Iraqi General Says 70 Percent of East Mosul Retaken From Islamic State
headline.print_headline: Iraqi General Says 70 Percent of East Mosul Retaken From Islamic State

docs.snippet: Euro zone producer prices rose for the third consecutive month in November on a monthly basis, mostly driven by soaring energy prices which offset subdued prices for consumer goods, estimates released on Thursday by Eurostat showed....
docs.lead_paragraph: Euro zone producer prices rose for the third consecutive month in November on a monthly basis, mostly driven by soaring energy prices which offset subdued prices for consumer goods, estimates released on Thursday by Eurostat showed.

headline.main: Euro Zone Producer Prices Rise in November, Consumer Goods Prices Subdued
headline.print_headline: Euro Zone Producer Prices Rise in November, Consumer Goods Prices Subdued

docs.snippet: Borrowing by small U.S. firms ticked up in November, data released on Thursday showed, as Americans unexpectedly elected Republican Donald Trump as their next president and investors bid up U.S. stocks on bets that tax cuts will boost profits....
docs.lead_paragraph: Borrowing by small U.S. firms ticked up in November, data released on Thursday showed, as Americans unexpectedly elected Republican Donald Trump as their next president and investors bid up U.S. stocks on bets that tax cuts will boost profits.

headline.main: U.S. Small Business Borrowing Rises as Trump Elected President
headline.print_headline: U.S. Small Business Borrowing Rises as Trump Elected President
